üöÄ Mission 15: Unit Conversion

*Measuring the world and converting units.*

üìú The Instructions

Unit Conversion 20-21 -

Read through the lesson - This lesson can be done together. Some of the children will need you to help them understand the concepts, play games with them or act as a scribe.

This is a Power Lesson. Power lessons are used to increase your students' level of math mastery. You can do this by submitting a video of your students doing the activity at the end of this lesson or a picture/scan of their written work.

üéí 1. Gear Checklist

Gather these exact items:

A ruler

A few things to measure, including two books or boxes.

A paper to keep track of their measurements

üéØ 2. Your Objectives

I can use what I know about ratios to convert units of measurement. (6.RP.3d)

I can change units of measurement correctly when multiplying or dividing quantities. (6.RP.3d)

üß† 3. Brain Download (The Lesson)

Links for videos and activities to learn:

Measuring Video

Unit Conversion | CK-12 Foundation

üó∫Ô∏è 4. The Adventure (Activity)

üìú Verbatim Instructions:

Today we will all be measuring things around our house and keeping track of what we measure. We will write down what we find out and can tell each other what we learned when we are done.

Measure the length, width and height of the book using inches. Record your answers and then figure out the volume of a book by using the formula V=lwh (Volume=length*width*height). This will give you an answer in inches cubed, or in^3. Next convert your measurements to centimeters from inches using the ratio 1 inch = 2.54 centimeters. Figure out the volume again this time in cm^3. Here is an example to help you out:

Discuss

When they are all finished, bring the family back together to have a discussion. Ask the following questions:

Which did you measure?

was the most challenging task? Why?

For some of the online activities you will need a free CK12 account.

To create a CK12 account:

Go to: https://www.ck12.org/student/

Click on the orange JOIN button in the upper right corner

Choose the option for email to sign up.

Enter your student's information. CK12 will ask students to input their teacher email. PLEASE ENTER THE TEACHER'S EMAIL: and the teacher will complete the registration process.

When registration is complete, the teacher will email you the username and password for your student account.

üí° üöÄ Mission Strategy: Step-by-Step

*(Use this guide to help you complete the instructions above)*

1. Find a book.

2. Step 1: Measure Length, Width, Height in INCHES.

3. Step 2: Calculate Volume (L x W x H).

4. Step 3: Convert dimensions to CM (Inches x 2.54).

5. Step 4: Calculate Volume in CM.

6. Compare the two numbers.
